Description: On October 29, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) and the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) issued a Consent Order to Lawrence Livermore National Security for deficiencies associated with implementation of the Chronic Beryllium Disease Prevention Program (CBDPP) and related work planning and control processes at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Bechtel, University of California, Babcock and Wilcox, URS, and Battelle)

Description: On September 25, 2014, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2014-03) to Lawrence Livermore National Security, LLC (LLNS), for violations of the Department of Energy's worker safety and health program (10 C.F.R. Part 851) associated with the sulfuric acid burn event that occurred at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. Penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Bechtel, University of California, Babcock and Wilcox, URS, and Battelle)

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 541712: Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Biotechnology)
Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Bechtel, University of California, Babcock and Wilcox, URS, and Battelle)
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
